events.name: Craft Beers and Cloud Platform
events.description:
Did you know that the Professional Cloud Architect exam uses some of the case studies at: https://cloud.google.com/certification/guides/cloud-architect/ ?
This week we will Look at: JencoMart https://cloud.google.com/certification/guides/cloud-architect/casestudy-jencomart
Topics for discussion will include:
1. What GCP products would they consider?
2. If there is product overlap, what information can we use in the case study to help the customer make a product decision or create a design?
3. If the information is not in the case study what questions would we ask for clarification and what answers can we anticipate?
4. Bonus: If there is interest or time- what does AWS or Azure solutions for this customer look like?

events.name: Next '18 Extended Phoenix: 32 Hands-on Labs
events.description:
Next '18 Extended Phoenix News: [masked] update)
Agenda:
1. Matt Gartner is a Customer Engineer at Google based in Boulder, CO. He has an extensive background in cloud IaaS, PaaS, SaaS design and networking. He will provide his insight into some of the key announcements from Next '18. Matt will also do an application building/deployment demo.
2. Hands-On Labs : Baseline: Data, ML, AI
a. Introduction to SQL for BigQuery and Cloud SQL
b. BigQuery: Qwik Start - Web User Interface
c. BigQuery: Qwik Start - Command Line
d. Bigtable: Qwik Start - Command Line
e. Bigtable: Qwik Start - Hbase Shell
f. Cloud Natural Language API: Qwik Start
g. Google Cloud Speech API: Qwik Start
h. Dataproc: Qwik Start - Console
i. Dataproc: Qwik Start - Command Line
j. Dataprep: Qwik Start
k. Google Cloud Datalab: Qwik Start
l. Cloud ML Engine: Qwik Start
m. Data Studio: Qwik Start
n. Google Genomics: Qwik Start
o. Dataflow: Qwik Start - Templates
p. Dataflow: Qwik Start - Python
q. Cloud Filestore: Qwik Start
r. Machine Learning with Spark on Google Cloud Dataproc
Processing Time Windowed Data with Apache Beam and Cloud Dataflow (Java)
s. Machine Learning with TensorFlow
t. Distributed Machine Learning with Google Cloud ML
u. Real Time Machine Learning with Google Cloud ML
v. Bayes Classification with Cloud Datalab, Spark and Pig on Google Cloud Dataproc
w. Machine Learning with Spark on Google Cloud Dataproc
x. Processing Time Windowed Data with Apache Beam and Cloud Dataflow (Java)
y. Machine Learning with TensorFlow
z. Distributed Machine Learning with Google Cloud ML
aa. Real Time Machine Learning with Google Cloud ML
bb. Bayes Classification with Cloud Datalab, Spark and Pig on Google Cloud Dataproc
cc. Citrix on GCP
dd. Stackdriver: Qwik Start
ee. Getting Started with Cloud KMS
4. VPC Deep Dive and Best Practices
5. Hybrid Cloud Notes from the Field: Connecting to Azure, AWS and On-premise
6. Certification: Design Methodology.
7. Lab Techniques for learning.

The rough structure for the event is like this:
1. Participate in different event schedules.
a. Full event (9 hours)
b. Day event (4 hours)
c. Evening Event (4 hours)
2. Pick your track:
a. Technical: Sessions and discussion
b. Hands-on Labs
c. Combination of both!

Google Home GiveAway and other giveaways based on registration numbers!

So if you need to get back home after work: Stay till 5.
If you can't get away after work: come after!
If you can fit the whole event in your schedule: cool!
Whatever hands-on level you want: 0 to 9 hours is available.

We recommend bringing:
- a laptop or device with a dedicated keyboard
- power cable/battery bank
- headphones, if you'd prefer to do labs solo

---

Food and beverage will be provided (vendors TBA). If you have any allergen/dietary considerations, please let us know ASAP so that we can best accommodate.

---

If you would like to apply to be a speaker or provide a demo of how you use Google cloud, please email a brief proposal to: roy.tokeshi (at) citrix.com

---

Shout out to phoenixNAP for providing us with an awesome venue, and for Google for providing support for this event <3

events.name: Building and Deploying Data Products on Google Cloud Platform + Hands on Labs
events.description:
Charles Zhan is currently a staff engineer and lead data scientist at Infusionsoft, where he is currently responsible for building data lakes and deploying data products. Prior to Infusionsoft, Charles worked at Honeywell as Principal Engineer. Charles earned a Ph.D. from ASU in 2008. Charles has been granted 7 patents in data analytics and system modeling.

He will talk about how Infusionsoft builds a data lake on Google Cloud Platform. He will talk about the challenges that he faced, how he solved the problems using tools like Airflow, Spark and offerings from GCP like Google Cloud Storage and BigQuery. He will also talk about how he deployed data products from problem formulation to deploying in a very cost-effective way using BigQuery, Dataflow, App Engine, GCS.

After his talk Google has provided these hands on labs:
(labs available only to registrants that provide the email address you plan to use for login to Qwiklabs prior to the event. Matt from Google will need to provision the lab classroom prior to the event.)

Advanced Track:
Weather Data in BigQuery
Dataflow: Qwik Start - Templates
Run a Big Data Text Processing Pipeline in Cloud Dataflow
Predict Visitor Purchases with a Classification Model in BQML
Predict Taxi Fare with a BigQuery ML Forecasting Model

Beginner Track:
App Engine: Qwik Start - Python
App Engine: Qwik Start - Go
App Engine: Qwik Start - Java
App Engine: Qwik Start - PHP
App Engine: Qwik Start - Ruby

We recommend bringing:
- a laptop or device with a dedicated keyboard
- power cable/battery bank
- headphones to hear optional videos

Food and beverage will be provided Citrix and phoenixNAP. If you have any allergen/dietary considerations, please let us know ASAP so that we can best accommodate.

Shout out to phoenixNAP for providing us with an awesome venue and sodas, Citrix for food, and Google for providing labs for this event <3
events.how_to_find_us: Please bring Photo ID.  This is across the street from the Waffle House

events.name: AI Hacknight: GDG + Gangplank Teamup
events.description:
GDG Cloud Phonix Holiday party in conjunction with Gangplank Queen Creek.
What: First 20 registrants get a 1/2 share of a Google Voice Kit. Everyone gets to have food and drinks, and check out the hack-space and current projects underway.
What to bring: Your imagination, appetite, and curiosity.
Where: Gangplank: Queen Creek
When: 5:30 pm for the tour and refreshments, 6:00 pm for the AI hack-build and refreshments until 9 pm.
Who: Family Friendly kids welcome for every 2 a free kit. Half share? If you bring a friend or family member you take your kit home, Or pay for the second half of the kit. Or rock-paper-scissors for the winner.
Age: The kit has an awesome blank cardboard outer layer. Any age can decorate. Raspberry Pi Zero assembly and some GCP configuration.
Why: The AIY Voice Kit from Google lets you build your own natural language processor and connect it to the Google Assistant. All of this fits in a handy little cardboard cube, powered by a Raspberry Pi. You will assemble your AIY Voice Kit, connect to it, and run the Google Assistant demo application.

events.name: GCP Customer Spotlight: Common Machine Learning Mistakes at Infusionsoft
events.description:
Check out Data Science Phoenix. GCP User Infusionsoft is doing a Machine Learning Talk. https://www.meetup.com/Data-Science-Phoenix/events/258065640/

From the Event description at https://www.meetup.com/Data-Science-Phoenix/
Description:
We are excited to partner with the team at Infusionsoft and host our first ever East Valley event! We will first hear about some "Common Machine Learning Mistakes" specifically that Brett (https://www.linkedin.com/in/brettnebeker/) encountered from applicants when recently looking to bring on a new member to his data science team.

Then Brett and Jason (https://www.linkedin.com/in/wolosonovich/) are going to talk about "Full-Stack Data Science". The days where data scientists are just expected to build models is somewhat over. Oftentimes, a data scientist is now also expected to get their model into production. Brett and Jason are going to talk about using Flask, Kubernetes, and Airflow at Infusionsoft to get their models into production!

events.name: Meetup-Teamup Cloud Study Jam + IoT with GDG Phoenix/ PHX Android
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with Google Cloud’s IoT Core service and its integration with other services like GCS, Dataprep, Stackdriver and Firestore. The labs in this quest use simulator code to mimic IOT devices and the learning here should empower you to implement the same streaming pipeline with real world IoT devices.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to complete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

At this event we are teaming up with the GDG Phoenix / Phoenix Android Meetup; https://www.meetup.com/PHX-Android/

events.name: Meetup-Teamup Cloud Study Jam + Docker Meetup
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with Kubernetes which is the most popular container orchestration system and it was designed specifically with Google Cloud Platform integration in mind. In this advanced-level quest, you will get hands-on practice configuring Docker images and containers, deploying fully-fledged Kubernetes Engine applications, and integrating Slackbot and MongoDB databases with Kubernetes. This quest will teach you the practical skills needed for integrating container orchestration into your own workflow.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to complete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

At this event we are teaming up with the Phoenix Docker Meetup; https://www.meetup.com/Docker-Phoenix/

events.name: Meetup-Teamup Data Science using Python + Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
Learn about various topics in Data Science using Python from recent Data Science graduates.
Presenters: TJ Slezak, Trevor Osborne, Chris Herman, and Joe Doperalski
Where:
McKesson in Scottsdale (North-middle of three buildings, Bldg. #2). When you enter security will have the RSVP list, have you sign in on the iPads, and direct you down the hall to the meetup room.

After presentations try some hands on Python on Google Cloud Platform.
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on lab experience showing you how to use a distributed configuration of TensorFlow code in Python on Google Cloud Machine Learning Engine to train a convolutional neural network model by using the MNIST dataset.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to complete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

At this event we are teaming up with the DesertPy - Phoenix Python Meetup Group https://www.meetup.com/Phoenix-Python-Meetup-Group/
events.how_to_find_us: The middle (North) building. Enter the building on the west side and check-in in at the security desk, receive a badge and proceed down the hall to the meetup room. Security should be there to let you in and send you the right direction.

events.name: Meetup-Teamup Cloud Study Jam + Advanced  Docker Meetup: Live Now!
events.description:
Already here and we have Sandwitches and cookies etc. Moved start time to allow late registration.
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with Containerized applications. Containers have changed the game and are here to stay. With Kubernetes, you can orchestrate containers with ease, and integration with the Google Cloud Platform is seamless. In this advanced-level quest, you will be exposed to a wide range of Kubernetes use cases and will get hands-on practice architecting solutions over the course of 9 labs. From building Slackbots with NodeJS, to deploying game servers on clusters, to running the Cloud Vision API, Kubernetes Solutions will show you first-hand how agile and powerful this container orchestration system is.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to complete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

At this event we are teaming up with the Phoenix Docker Meetup; https://www.meetup.com/Docker-Phoenix/

events.name: Human + Machine Learning
events.description:
Please support the leader of our sister GDG Phoenix group Mike Wolgson who is a GDEL: Google Developer Expert.

Also Chris Huie (another local rock start that needs no introduction)

**Please RSVP HERE also (https://www.eventbrite.com/e/human-machine-learning-tickets-58686266202)**

Abstract
------------
As we use Machine Learning in our software - we need to understand the impact on what we build. The Design team at Google has created a framework named Human-Centered Machine Learning (HCML) to help us focus and guide that understanding. I will introduce this concept and show how you can use it in your development process.

I will show how HCML can be used to answer important questions like: Is ML right for this problem? What unique solution does ML provide? Are we using the right information to train our system? What is the impact of wrong results?

Just like with the web and mobile revolutions, ML will force us to consider new possibilities for every experience we build. We must stay grounded in human needs while solving them in unique ways. HCML provides techniques to help us accomplish this.

Schedule
-------------
6:00 - 6:45 - Eat, Meet, & Greet
6:45 - 7:00 - Introduction / Announcements
7:00 - 7:45 - Human + Machine Learning
7:45 - 8:15 - Questions...

About the Speaker
-------------------------
Google Developer Expert in Android Mike Wolfson is a product-focused developer working in Phoenix. He has been working in the software field for more than 20 years, and with Android since its introduction. He is a Google Developer Expert in Android and the author of the book "Android Developer Tools Essentials" published by O’Reilly.

He has spoken about Android and mobile development at a variety of conferences and user groups (including Google IO, Oscon, GDGSiliconValley, Droidcon NYC & Turin, AnDevCon, and others). When he is not geeking out about phones, he enjoys the outdoors (snowboarding, hiking, scuba diving), collecting PEZ dispensers, and chasing his young (but quick) daughter.

Mike works for "Nerdery" as a Principal Software Engineer and is passionate about making technology work for the user.

Sponsors
-------------
About Nerdery:
Nerdery is a digital business consultancy. We take companies from today to their digital futures, working at the leading edge of strategy, design and technology to help clients evolve and thrive. By focusing on business outcomes, Nerdery crafts impactful digital experiences and infrastructures that accelerate digital transformations, innovations, modernizations and operational initiatives. By combining capabilities, Nerdery is focused on a core set of offerings that drive exponential business value. Nerdery was founded in 2003 with western regional headquarters in Phoenix and offices in Minneapolis and Chicago.

About Galvanize:
Galvanize is a premier institution for learning software engineering and data science in Phoenix and technical cities across the country. We immerse our students in full-time and part-time education for those looking to get into the software engineering or data science fields. Prior knowledge and effort on your part are expected but as a technology community, we are truly here to support you on your journey to learn.

Want to learn more about Galvanize's data science and software engineering programs in Phoenix? (https://www.galvanize.com/courses/request-info)
events.how_to_find_us: Only park in Galvanize lot. All spots are open parking expect spots that say "Galvanize Reserved #XX"

events.name: Data Science AI/ML StudyJam
events.description:
*** Please RSVP on Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/intro-to-data-science-predictive-modeling-tickets-62503849697?aff=meetup ***

If you’re curious about the field of Data Science, you’ve probably heard the terms “predictive modeling” or ""machine learning."" In this interactive workshop, we’ll discuss the emerging field of Data Science, fundamental concepts in predictive modeling, and work together to implement those in a Python environment.

Suggested Experience Level:
Intermediate - no previous coding knowledge is required, though some experience with data is a plus

What to Bring:
Laptop
Water bottle

Sponsored by Thinkful:
This workshop is proudly sponsored by Thinkful, the #1 rated coding boot camp on CourseReport. Thinkful specializes in high-growth tech careers and provides 1-on-1 learning through its network of industry experts, hiring partners, and online platform to deliver a structured and flexible education. To join the Thinkful network, visit thinkful.com.
events.how_to_find_us: 2100 N Central Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85004 Once inside, head to the main floor Board Room. The Encanto/Central lightrail stop is located 3 blocks from the building. There is also free onsite parking available in the garage off of Central Ave or Holly St.

group_profile.intro: 14 year engineer at Citrix, passionate about all things cloud.
